title: Student Loan Breach Exposes 2.5M Records
description: 2.5 million people were affected, in a breach that could spell more trouble down the line.

title: Watering Hole Attacks Push ScanBox Keylogger
description: Researchers uncover a watering hole attack likely carried out by APT TA423, which attempts to plant the ScanBox JavaScript-based reconnaissance tool.

title: Tentacles of ‘0ktapus’ Threat Group Victimize 130 Firms
description: Over 130 companies tangled in sprawling phishing campaign that spoofed a multi-factor authentication system.

title: Ransomware Attacks are on the Rise
description: Lockbit is by far this summer’s most prolific ransomware group, trailed by two offshoots of the Conti group.

title: Cybercriminals Are Selling Access to Chinese Surveillance Cameras
description: Tens of thousands of cameras have failed to patch a critical, 11-month-old CVE, leaving thousands of organizations exposed.

title: Twitter Whistleblower Complaint: The TL;DR Version
description: Twitter is blasted for security and privacy lapses by the company’s former head of security who alleges the social media giant’s actions amount to a national security risk.

title: Firewall Bug Under Active Attack Triggers CISA Warning
description: CISA is warning that Palo Alto Networks’ PAN-OS is under active attack and needs to be patched ASAP.

title: Fake Reservation Links Prey on Weary Travelers
description: Fake travel reservations are exacting more pain from the travel weary, already dealing with the misery of canceled flights and overbooked hotels.

title: iPhone Users Urged to Update to Patch 2 Zero-Days
description: Separate fixes to macOS and iOS patch respective flaws in the kernel and WebKit that can allow threat actors to take over devices and are under attack.

title: Google Patches Chrome’s Fifth Zero-Day of the Year
description: An insufficient validation input flaw, one of 11 patched in an update this week, could allow for arbitrary code execution and is under active attack.
